text.div:
NameCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
DocumentManifest ResourceA manifest that defines a set of documents
masterIdentifier 1..1IdentifierUnique Identifier for the set of documents
identifier 0..*IdentifierOther identifiers for the manifest
subject 1..*Patient | Practitioner | Group | DeviceThe subject of the set of documents
recipient 0..*Patient | Practitioner | OrganizationIntended to get notified about this set of documents
type 0..1CodeableConceptWhat kind of document set this is
DocumentSetType (Incomplete)
author 0..*Practitioner | Device | Patient | RelatedPersonWho and/or what authored the document
created 0..1dateTimeWhen this document manifest created
source 0..1uriThe source system/application/software
status 1..1codecurrent | superceded | entered in error
DocumentReferenceStatus (Required)
supercedes 0..1DocumentManifestIf this document manifest replaces another
description 0..1stringHuman-readable description (title)
confidentiality 0..1CodeableConceptSensitivity of set of documents
DocumentConfidentiality (Incomplete)
content 1..*DocumentReference | Binary | MediaContents of this set of documents

structure.purpose: This is the definition for the DocumentManifest resource

definition.short: A manifest that defines a set of documents
definition.formal: A manifest that defines a set of documents.

definition.short: Additional Content defined by implementations
definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
definition.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

definition.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
definition.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

definition.short: Language of the resource content
definition.formal: The base language in which the resource is written.
definition.comments:
Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource

Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

definition.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
definition.formal: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
definition.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

definition.short: Contained, inline Resources
definition.formal: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
definition.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

definition.short: Unique Identifier for the set of documents
definition.formal: A single identifier that uniquely identifies this manifest. Principally used to refer to the manifest in non-FHIR contexts.

mapping.map: id [need a list semantic to indicate order matters]

definition.short: Other identifiers for the manifest
definition.formal: Other identifiers associated with the document, including version independent, source record and workflow related identifiers.
definition.comments:
Other identifiers can also include Identifiers may be Accession Numbers, Order Numbers, Referral Request 
Identifiers, XDS Workflow Instance Identifiers.

definition.short: The subject of the set of documents
definition.formal: Who or what the set of documents is about. The documents can be about a person, (patient or healthcare practitioner), a device (i.e. machine) or even a group of subjects (such as a document about a herd of farm animals, or a set of patients that share a common exposure). If the documents cross more than one subject, then more than one subject is allowed here (unusual use case).

definition.short: Intended to get notified about this set of documents
definition.formal: A patient, practitioner, or organization for which this set of documents is intended.
definition.comments: How the recipient receives the document set or is notified of it is up to the implementation. This element is just a statement of intent.

definition.short: What kind of document set this is
definition.formal: Specifies the kind of this set of documents (e.g. Patient Summary, Discharge Summary, Prescription, etc.). The type of a set of documents may be the same as one of the documents in it - especially if there is only one - but it may be wider.

binding.name: DocumentSetType
binding.description: Specifies the kind of a set of documents (e.g. Patient Summary, Discharge Summary, Prescription, etc.). The type of a set of documents may be the same as one of the documents in the set - especially if there is only one - but it may be wider

definition.short: Who and/or what authored the document
definition.formal: Identifies who is responsible for adding the information to the document.
definition.comments: Not necessarily who did the actual data entry (i.e. typist) or who was the source (informant).

definition.short: When this document manifest created
definition.formal: When the document manifest was created for submission to the server (not necessarily the same thing as the actual resource last modified time, since it may be modified, replicated etc).
definition.comments: Creation time is used for tracking, organizing versions and searching. This is the creation time of the document set, not the documents on which it is based.

definition.short: The source system/application/software
definition.formal: Identifies the source system, application, or software that produced the document manifest.

definition.short: current | superceded | entered in error
definition.formal: The status of this document manifest.

binding.name: DocumentReferenceStatus
binding.description: The status of the document reference

definition.short: If this document manifest replaces another
definition.formal: Whether this document manifest replaces another.

definition.short: Human-readable description (title)
definition.formal: Human-readable description of the source document. This is sometimes known as the "title".
definition.comments: What the document is about, rather than a terse summary of the document. It is commonly the case that records do not have a title and are collectively referred to by the display name of Record code (e.g. a "consultation" or "progress note").

definition.short: Sensitivity of set of documents
definition.formal: A code specifying the level of confidentiality of this set of Documents.
definition.comments: The document set is at least as confidential as the most confidential of the documents in it.

binding.name: DocumentConfidentiality
binding.description: Codes specifying the level of confidentiality of the composition

definition.short: Contents of this set of documents
definition.formal: The list of resources that describe the parts of this document reference. Usually, these would be document references, but direct references to binary attachments and images are also allowed.

definition.short: A manifest that defines a set of documents
definition.formal: A manifest that defines a set of documents.

definition.short: Unique Identifier for the set of documents
definition.formal: A single identifier that uniquely identifies this manifest. Principally used to refer to the manifest in non-FHIR contexts.

mapping.map: id [need a list semantic to indicate order matters]

definition.comments:

definition.formal: Human-readable description of the source document. This is sometimes known as the "title".
definition.comments: What the document is about, rather than a terse summary of the document. It is commonly the case that records do not have a title and are collectively referred to by the display name of Record code (e.g. a "consultation" or "progress note").

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)

searchParam.name: _language
searchParam.documentation: The stated language of the resource

searchParam.name: author
searchParam.documentation: Who and/or what authored the document

searchParam.name: content
searchParam.documentation: Contents of this set of documents

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Unique Identifier for the set of documents

searchParam.name: recipient
searchParam.documentation: Intended to get notified about this set of documents

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: The subject of the set of documents

searchParam.name: supersedes
searchParam.documentation: If this document manifest replaces another

searchParam.name: type
searchParam.documentation: What kind of document set this is
